item.title: Comment on Regulating Sausages by Hadur
item.description:
Reply to GK:

> Could not tort law, insurance, and a few simple rules substitute at lower cost and without stifling innovation?

Insurance and simple rules, yes, but tort law is expensive, complex and uncertain. If you think the rules set by bureaucrats are convoluted, try a few decades of case law.

Regulation by tort law is one of the worst scenarios possible. There are no safe harbors when every greedy tort lawyer and every ambitious state attorney general are looking for ways to make their name and fortune.
